info.title: Flight Check-in Links
info.description:
# Introduction

The Flight Check-in Links REST/JSON API helps simplify the check-in process for your users by providing direct access to the airlineâ€™s check-in page. 
The following search parameters are required:
- Provider code: airline code
- Check-in page language

The response is a list of one or more URLs with associated attributes:
- the href
- the channel (Web or Mobile)
- an optional list of parameters that need to be filled if the URL contains dynamic parameters

# Authorization

Before using the API you will need to get an access token. Please read our **[Authorization Guide](https://developers.amadeus.com/self-service/apis-docs/guides/authorization)** for more information on how to get your token.

# Supported Operations

Resource: checkin-links

HTTP Method: GET

parameters.name: airlineCode
parameters.description:
Airline code following IATA or ICAO standard - e.g. 1X; AF or ESY

[IATA table codes](http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx)

[ICAO airlines table codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airline_codes)

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
Check-in page language with one of the following patterns 'languageCode' (e.g. EN) or 'languageCode-IATAcountryCode' (e.g. en-GB). 

Default value is **en-GB** (used when required language is not available or when no value is specified).

href.description: direct URL to the relevant page

channel.description: indicates the type of channel supported by the URL

parameters.description: list of URL parameters with descriptive information such as description and/or type and/or format

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this error

title.description: a short summary of the error

source.title: Issue_Source
source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the issue

example.description: a string indicating an example of the right value
